titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Joseph Norton Ireland Papers
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday January 23, 2019 at 04:52

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The collection contains material relating to Ireland's research and writings on American theater and personal papers. Forty-nine volumes in the collection contain clippings, printed ephemera, such as playbills, autograph manuscript material, letters, and other material, as well as lists of theatrical performances and lists and profiles of stage performers. The collection features drafts, proofs, and an extra-illustrated version of Ireland's major publication, Records of the New York Stage from 1750 to 1860.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of William Ireland Starr in memory of Susan Ireland Starr, 1945.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Joseph Norton Ireland Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Joseph Norton Ireland Papers. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The collection received preliminary processing around the time of acquisition in 1945. Further organization, rehousing, and description were carried out in 2012.

bioghist.head: Joseph Norton Ireland (1817-1898)
bioghist.p: Joseph Norton Ireland, one of the major early historians of the American theater, entered his father's business after graduating from high school in his native New York. Leaving the company in 1855 and retiring to Bridgeport, Connecticut, Ireland devoted the rest of his life to studying and writing about the stage. His major work was Records of the New York Stage from 1750–1860 (1866–67), although he also wrote two biographies, Mrs. Duff (1882) and A Memoir of the Professional Life of Thomas Abthorpe Cooper (1888).
Biographical information taken from the Oxford Companion to American Theatre .

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Joseph Norton Ireland papers contains material relating to Ireland's research and writing on American theater and personal papers. Forty-nine volumes in the collection contain clippings, printed ephemera, such as playbills, autograph manuscript material, letters, and other material, as well as lists of theatrical performances and lists and profiles of stage performers. Also included are drafts, proofs, and an extra-illustrated version of Ireland's major publication, Records of the New York Stage from 1750 to 1860 .

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into three series: I. Bound Volumes, 1770-1885. II. Manuscripts, 1852-1880. III. Other Material, 1807-1902.

controlaccess.corpname: Park Theatre (New York, N.Y. : Park Row)

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by title or supplied heading.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series I. Bound Volumes contains material relating to Joseph Norton Ireland's research on American theater dating from the sixteenth through nineteenth centuries. Scrapbooks and other volumes contain clippings, printed ephemera, including playbills, autograph manuscript material, letters, and other material. There are also lists of theatrical performances and lists and profiles of stage performers. The series features an extra-illustrated version of Ireland's major publication, Records of the New York Stage from 1750 to 1860 .
